alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Okeechobee; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Okeechobee, western Indian River, southern Brevard and southeastern Osceola Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Camp Holly Fish Camp to near Kenansville to Sebring Regional Airport. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Fellsmere, Malabar, Barefoot Bay and Lake Marian. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central Florida.
